body.p: A Kentucky attorney and politician. Graduated from Transylvania University in 1844 and again from the law department in 1846. Admitted to the bar and practiced law in Taylorsville, Kentucky. Married to Elizabeth Shelby Gilbert Burnett. Father of Mary Burnett Grant, John C. Burnett, Gilbert Burnett, Theodore L. Burnett, and Marie Burnett. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860. Elected Spencer County attorney in 1847. Served in the Mexican War. Served in the Army of the Tennessee under General Albert S. Johnston in 1861. Served as a member of the Provisional Congress of the Confederate States from 1861 to 1862. Served the Sixth Congressional District as a member of the First and Second Confederate Congress in the House of Representatives from 1862 to 1865.
